rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Mechanism of wood ethanolysis and the structure of lignin.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Recent reviews on the structure of lignin by von Wacek (1), Fraidenberg (2), Erdtman (3) and Hibbert (4) have emphasized the essentially aromatic character of lignin and its relationship to coniferyl types. During the period 1897 (5) to 1936 (6), Klason's original "coniferyl-oxyconiferyl alcohol hypothesis", in which polymers of coniferyl alcohol, coniferyl aldehyde, guaicol aldol, etc. were included, underwent various modifications. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The price system, inflation, and price control in wartime.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: That wartime prices are high prices is clearly revealed in Chart I of Wholesale Prices in the United States through Five Wars, 1800 - 1941. Indeed one is tempted to draw the purely empirical conclusion that the more intense and widespread, the longer a war lasts, the greater are bound to be price movements. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Prices.
War -- Economic Aspects.
Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Deux predicateurs Français: Adolphe et Wilfred Monod.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Dans une piece moderne, l'intrigue est basée sur la force mystérieuse et irresistible qui joint les coeurs de deux personnes, vivant à des époques différentes, mais dont la grandeur de l'amour anéantit le Temps. Nous entreprenons ici une tâche analogue: l'étude de deux prédicateurs, qui vivaient à des époques différentes, qui se trouvaient en face de problèmes différents, qui essayèrent de les résoudre par des moyens différents, et qui pourtant se réunirent dans une devotion commune et dans une commune loyauté au même Sauveur. Pref, l'étude de deux hommes, mais d'"une seule chose". [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Monod, Adolphe, 1802-1856.
French.
Monod, Wilfred, 1867-1943.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The stark effect in lead and tin.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Stark effect in lead and tin has been investigated over the region 3200 - 2600 A. using a modified Lo Surdo source. In lead, five lines of the normal spectrum have been photographed. No measurable displacement was observed on any of these lines in an electric field of 85 Kv. per cm. In tin, seven lines in this region have been photographed and in an electric field of 80 Kv. per cm., no displacements were observed. The technique in the Lo Surdo method of investigating Stark effect in metals of low melting point has been improved by the design of a cathode spacer.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Les Etats-Unis de 1919 à 1939 vus par les écrivains francais contemporains.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of French Language and Literature
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In this thesis are noted the opinions about the United States expressed by contemporary French writers during the two decades between World War I and II. Necessarily, in a study of limited length it was requisite to choose certain aspects. Thus leaving aside the economic and political, so frequently treated to the exclusion of all other phases, the position of the woman and man in American society is studied. Then follows the consideration of the family life, religious life, intellectual and artistic life of this period, which serve as both the framework and the raison d'etre of the American man and woman.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: United States -- Social conditions -- 1918-1932.
French literature -- 20th century -- History and criticism.
United States -- In literature.
United States -- Social conditions -- 1933-1945.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the acid-oxalate fraction of some podsolic soils.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The present work is an application of Tamm's method of extraction for the study of sail profiles. O. Tamm in 1922, studied the movement of iron, aluminum and silica in the soil, by making extracts of each horizon of the profile with an aqueous solution of a mixture of ammonium oxalate and oxalic acid. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on speckled leaf blotch of oats (septoria avenae frank).
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Speckled leaf blotch of oats is caused by an imperfect fungus, Septoria avenae Frank. The perfect form, Leptosphaeria avenaria Weber, is an ascomycete rarely found in nature and consequently of secondary importance. The disease has received different names as "Speckled leaf blotch", "Septoria leaf spot" and "Leptosphaeria leaf spot". In France "nuile" is the most common name. In 1941, the Quebec Society for the Protection of Plants named it "tache septorienne des feuilles". The english common name "speckled leaf blotch" has been assigned to it by the Common Names Committee of the Canadian Phytopathological Society. The latter name was used by Weber (1922). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Plant Pathology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Quebec pasture studies : I. Fertility studies with the greensboro loam soil. II. Establishment and succession of seeded pastures as affected by the climatic and biotic factors.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Grassland is, for the average farmer in Eastern Canada, the most important and at the same time the most abused of all the crops grown on the average farm. The concept that the best fields on a farm should be used for growing grain and cultivated crops is a very old one. Pasture, in many cases, has been placed on land which was too rough for cultivation, or on land reduced in fertility by previous cropping. Indeed, the idea has been quite prevalent in some sections that it is a waste of land to put pastures on soils which are capable of producing other crops. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agronomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some studies on tertiary hexadecyl mercaptan as a modifier in butadiene-styrene copolymerizations.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Tertiary hexadecyl mercaptan was investigated as a modifier in the emulsion copolymerization of butadiene and styrene. This mercaptan disappeared slowly during the first 50-60 per cent of the polymerization but underwent a rapid increase in rate of disappearance thereafter. This rapid rate of disappearance at high conversion cannot be accounted for on the basis of changing styrene content during polymerization or upon mercaptan addition to the polymer double bonds. Changes in viscosity of the polymer during polymerization were studied. A decrease was observed in the same conversion range where the rate of the mercaptan disappearance increased. Tertiary hexadecyl mercaptan was applied to the preparation of relatively homogeneous polymers of different composition and molecular size. On the basis of the modifier reaction theory polymers of various compositions but of the same molecular weight were prepared and studied. It was found that the viscosity decreased and the solubility increased with an increase in the styrene content of the polymer.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The dielectric constant of disulfur decafluoride, and high pressure instrumentation at high temperatures.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Part I - The Dielectric Constant of S2F10. Highly purified disulfur deoafluoride was found to have a freezing point of -54.2ºC. Dielectric measurements on the liquid and vapour using a refined Schering bridge revealed the following: Dielectric constant (liquid, 0ºC.) - 2.064; dielectric constant (vapour, 50cm.) - 1.0028; power factor (liquid 0°c.) - 0.0311; specific conductivity (A.C.,0ºc.) - 1.94 x 10^-10 mhos; molar polarization - 33.4 c.c.; atomic polarization - 12.1 c.c.; dipole moment - 0. These indicate that S2F10 is a highly stable non polar dielectric. Part II - High Pressure Instrumentation At High Temperatures. Four reliable instruments for P-V-T measurements on gases at 100 atmospheres and 1500ºc. have been developed: i - A furnace temperature controller for the range 150 to 1500ºc., accurate to 0.1ºc.; ii - A condenser depth probe for an all steel mercury compressor and a contact electronic vc circuit acting as depth indicator; iii - A capacitive mercury manometer for pressures in the range one to five atmospheres, accurate to .0005 atmospheres; iv - A differential pressure gauge and electrical indicator with sensitivity, .0l atmospheres, range, 10 atmospheres, 500% overload safety factor, and working pressure, 100 atmospheres.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A comparison of the lignins from plant materials by ethanolysis. --.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Plants have been of interest to mankind from very early times. [...] As the number of plants which were described became greater, it was apparent that some had many characteristics in common, others only a few, and it was logical then, for students of plant life to classify plants according to the physical characteristics such as could be readily recognized. [...] The botanist has found that all plants may be divided into two major groups; the members of one group (Vascular plants) have a vein system and are characterized by possessing distinguishable roots, stems and leaves; the members of the other group (Non-vascular plants) which have developed more slowly are without a vein system. [...] Those plants which possess a vein system and are termed the Vascular plants are divided into Spermatophytes or Flowering plants and Pteridophytes or ferns depending on the method of reproduction. The Spermatophytes which are the most highly developed are reproduced by seeds and the Pteridophytes, like all Non-Vascular plants, are reproduced by spores. [...] The chemist has already made some progress in determining chemical differences between the Classes of Spermatophytes, the cellulose, hemicellulose, and certain minor components have been shown to differ and it was naturally of interest to determine if general chemical differences in lignins occurred as seemed likely from earlier work. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Supreme political power in Greek literature of the fifth century, B.C.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis attempts to trace the development of one phase of political philosophy in fifth century Greece-- a theory of supreme political power. The first section discusses the necessary differences between the theory held by the Greeks and that held by modern thinkers. This subject is divided into comparisons between the Greek and modern theories concerning the state, the individual, law, and society. The next section deals briefly with some writers prior to the fifth century who were concerned with this problem. It gives some examples of the Greek love of liberty and equality which characterises fifth century thought and is of prime importance in the conception of supreme political power. The last section gives in some detail opinions on this subject held by the main writers of the fifth century, and, if such opinions are not specifically stated, they are inferred from the general political attitude of the author.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Greek literature -- History and criticism.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Foreign exchange control 1931-1940. --.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The analytical approach to foreign exchange control can take one of two consistent forms. The technique can be explored in relation to the absolute criterion of international specialization or, it can be examined in relation to the relative criterion of national expediency. However, it is impossible to deal with the subject consistently if we accept the relative premise and apply the absolute criterion to it. [...] This works purports to examine (1) whether exchange control is a technique in a secular trend or, merely an emergency measure; (2) are its characteristics universal or specific to the economy in which it exists; (3) has it performed its functions adequately in recent applications, (193l-1940); (4) what are its potentialities as an institution in future world economy; and (5) what impact will it have upon Canadian economy. [...] The aim of this thesis has been to approach the study of economic conditions in contemporary Germany and the Continent from an impartial and objective standpoint. The conclusions reached in the first four chapters must be qualified by the use of secondary sources and the conglomeration of other factors which belie the success or failure of the technique itself. In the Canadian-American situation the authorities do not find it advisable to offer all the pertinent information. We have therefore been obliged to use less authoritative indices and refrain from making any vulnerable long-term generalizations. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Foreign exchange -- Law and legislation.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Comparative digestibility by rabbits of ether extract and true fats of feeds. --.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Animal Nutrition and Breeding
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A digestion trial, comparing the digestibility of ether extract and true fats of feeds is reported. Rabbits were used as the experimental animals. The true fat fraction was determined according to the method recently developed by Horwitt and co-workers. The standard procedure (A.O.A.C.) was used for the determination of ether extract. The true fat content of a high fat feed (soya bean) was found to be completely digestible. In grass the digestibility of true fats was lower. This was probably due to the fact that the grass cell had a higher fiber content, which hindered the complete action of the digestive enzymes upon the cell constituents. The separation of the ether extract of feeds into fractions of high and low digestibility is suggested, in order to give a better index of its nutritive value.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Animal Nutrition and Breeding.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Integrator-counter for muscle spike-potentials.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The problem of scoring electromyographic records with its attendant time-consuming measurement of amplitudes, frequencies and means of muscle-potentials has given rise to a demand for automatic instruments for the performance of these tasks. An example of the work involved in scoring a single record in a Pain Sensitivity Test given routinely at the Allan Memorial Institute of Psychiatry required that the scorer measure by hand the sum of the voltage deflections and the number of deflections during 40 three-second intervals selected from a 45-minute continuous recording. The mean deflections were then determined from these two measures. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the behaviour of the univalents of certain aberrant wheats during microsporogenesis.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: There are several mutants of Triticum vulgare Host, which may be distinguished cytologically as well as phenotypically. The normal type has twenty-one pairs of homologous chromosomes. Those types which are being studied in this work are characterized by having either twenty pairs of homologous chromosomes and one univalent, or twenty pairs of homologous chromosomes and two heteromorphic chromosomes which may or may not pair at meiosis. The mutant wheats studied were an anomalous 41-chromosome homozygous speltoid, B and C Series heterozygous speltoids, sub-normals, sub-compactoids, and a homozygous compactoid. Plants of these different mutants may be distinguished by various characters of the head such as shape of glume and length and compactness of head. These mutants form a series of types grading from those like Triticum spelta L. (homozygous speltoids) through heterozygous speltoids to normals and through sub-normals and sub-compactoids to those which resemble Triticum compactum Host. (compactoids) The characters grade from long loose heads with square-shouldered glumes in speltoids to short compact heads with almost shoulderless glumes in compactoids. [...] Homozygous compactoids have twenty-one bivalents. They differ from the normals in that they have two Co chromosomes instead of two C chromosomes. Quite frequently these chromosomes, like the Co in sub-compactoids, pair within themselves and so appear as univalents. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Genetics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The reaction of hydrogen atoms with isobutane. --.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Although the attention of the earliest chemists was probably attracted to slowly progressing chemical changes, no definite ideas about the inherent nature of chemical action could be formed until quantitative investigations on the rate of reactions were made. [...] In as much as the reactions of the simple hydrocarbons are of great importance from both the theoretical and industrial points of view, it is not surprising that keen interest has been shown in their thermal decomposition mechanisms. Unfortunately, however, the thermal decomposition reactions of these compounds generally involve complicated steps, difficult to untangle, with the result that to deduce a mechanism from the experimental data obtained is, in many cases, little better than pure speculation. Consequently present day trend, in the field of gas kinetics, is to the more simple and elementary processes and for this reason investigations with the lower members of the aliphatic hydrocarbons have been favoured. Since the available information on the reactions of the simple hydrocarbons comes from a variety of sources it is considered desirable to outline briefly, in a general way, the information that can be obtained by various independent methods. Before doing this, however, it is necessary to discuss briefly the essential features of unimolecular gas reactions generally. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The chemical structure of dextran I.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Of recent years, following the elucidation of the oonstitution and structure of the more common mono- and di-saccharides, the attention of carbohydrate chemists has been focussed more and more strongly on the higher polysaccharides. For example, among the plant polysaccharides, it has been definitely established that cellulose is a long linear-chain polymer formed from anhydro-glucose units. In the case of inulin and levan, the chain is made up of anhydro-fructose units, while xylan and other pentosans are linear anhydro-pentose polymers.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Organ specific growth factors in the frog tadpole.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: That the individuals of a species resemble one another has been accounted for by their having a common growth pattern pertaining to the species alone. By growth pattern, it has been meant both the definite temporal order according to which growth starts in one part of an organism after another and the definite relationships among the growth rates of the different parts. (Weiss '39) In the presence of a growth promoting factor, the different parts of the organism may, or may not, respond to the same extent. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Zoology.
Tadpoles.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Anode potentials of lead and lead alloys.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In electrowinning of metals from aquous solutions and in many other electrochemical industries where insoluble anodes are necessary, lead and lead-base alloys are among the most important anode materials. Other anodes may be desirable under certain circumstances but lead and lead alloy anodes hold their unique position whenever the electrolyte used happens to be a sulfate solution and, since sulfuric acid is a cheap solvant which is widely used in electrochemical and electrometallurgical processes, lead and lead alloy anodes have frequently been found unsurpassable in practice. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The adaptation of kidney tests to small laboratory rodents.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Methods of estimating the excretory capacity of the kidney by the administration of various compounds and the determination of their concentration in the urine have long been in use. The specificity of these tests has increased to the point, where, today, we are able to determine not only the efficiency of the kidney as a whole, but of the various parts of that organ. Some of the earliest tests were performed on man and among these were the observations of Todd (69) and Charcot (5), Roberts (56), Duckworth (13) and Chauvet (7) who published accounts of the excretion, in disease, of various drugs, among which were mercury, iodides, quinine and many others.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Anatomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The English sheriff : 1600-1642.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Canadian research student working in the field of English history is necessarily hampered by the inaccessability of original documents. The following work has been constructed, therefore, from material culled out of printed sources like the Calendar of State Papers, Domestic; Acts of the Privy Council; Historical Manuscripts Commission; Journals of the House of Commons; and the Statutes of the Realm. These sources exhaust the material available to anyone treating this subject in Canada. This work represents an attempt to make the student of English history, sheriff conscious. For as yet, this official has not received the attention rightfully due him as an important dignitary in the county government of England. Moreover, in my opinion, taking an institution and then watching it undergo a slow change over a certain period of time, is the very stuff of history. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Sheriffs -- England.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Beneficiation of siderite ores.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Beneficiation of iron ore is the term applied to the many processes or combination of processes by which the ore is made more adaptable for smelting in the iron blast-furnace. Iron ore beneficiation methods are largely determined by the nature of iron ores as well as by the blast-furnace requirements. In modern blast-furnace practice the structure of the ore and the chemical composition are both of importance. Certainly, the higher the iron content and the lower the silica, phosphorus and sulphur, the more desirable the ore becomes, but if its structure is bad, that is, if the blast-furnace gases penetrate the lumps of ore with difficulty, the ore is even less satisfactory than one of poorer chemical composition but more porous structure. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Metallurgical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: La peinture de l’amour dans les premiers romans de Paul Bourget. --.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Paul Bourget, qu'il est d'usage de considérer surtout comme un romancier à idées, - c'est à dire, écrivant des ouvrages qui présentent une thèse à disouter, - est aussi, si on le replace dans la lignée des romanciers français, un des plus grands romanciers psychologues. Il a consacré au moins la moitié de son oeuvre à l'étude des complexités des passions de l'amour. Il est d'usage, en effet, de distinguer deux groupes d'ouvrages dans sa production. Le premier groupe est avant tout l'oeuvre d'un psychologue qui regarde dans le coeur de l'homme pour y suivre la naissance et le délevoppement des passions. L'auteur étudie l'individu et les problèmes de son âme. Les derniers romans, cependant, s'éloignent un peu des problèmes de l'individu pour sa préoccuper d'avantage de ceux de la société en général, réflétant ainsi les pensées d'un auteur plus intéressé par la sociologie que par la psychologie. Parce que l'auteur mûri se soucie avant tout du bien de la société, on parle souvent des romans de sa deuxième manière comme de l'oeuvre d'un moraliste, en laissant de côté les premiers romans. Le vrai, pourtant, c'est que le moralists s'est lentement épanoui chez l'auteur comme l'aboutissement natural de ses études sur l'individu. En tant que "physiologists de l'amour moderne," il avait déjà noté les devoirs moraux de l'individu envers le reste de la société. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Love in literature.
Bourget, Paul, 1852-1935 -- Criticism and interpretation.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Chemical studies in soil variability.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Variation in soils formed under different combinations of soil forming factors is to be expected. and such variation may be visible on observation of the soil itself. However, that appreciable soil variation should exist within the same area and within relatively short distances in fields selected for their uniformity has not been so fully realized.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agronomy.
